name: Kadhai Paneer
description: A medium-spiced dish enriched with authentic Indian flavors, featuring fresh, fluffy paneer cubes cooked with vibrant bell peppers, onions, and a rich tomato-based gravy. Perfectly paired with naan or roti, this dish offers a delightful balance of heat and aroma.
procedure: Cut paneer into cubes and lightly fry until golden.
Chop the vegetables (onion, tomatoes, bell peppers).
Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds, dry red chilies, and crushed coriander seeds.
Add ginger and garlic, cooking until fragrant.
Add onions and cook until golden.
Stir in tomato puree, turmeric, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook until oil separates.
Add diced bell peppers and sauté for 2-3 minutes.
Gently mix in the paneer cubes.
Add salt and crushed kasuri methi. Simmer for 5-7 minutes.
Add cream if desired for richness.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with naan, roti, or rice.

name: Butter Chicken
description: A rich and creamy dish with marinated chicken cooked in a buttery tomato-based gravy, flavored with mild spices. Best enjoyed with naan or jeera rice, offering a perfect blend of sweetness and spice.
procedure: Marinate chicken with yogurt, turmeric, red chili powder, and ginger-garlic paste. Rest for 1-2 hours.
Grill or sear the marinated chicken pieces until slightly charred.
Heat butter in a pan, add cumin seeds, and sauté chopped onions until golden.
Add tomato puree, turmeric, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook until oil separates.
Stir in cream, a pinch of sugar, and kasuri methi for a rich texture.
Add grilled chicken pieces to the gravy. Simmer for 10-12 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Palak Paneer
description: A healthy and flavorful dish of soft paneer cubes cooked in creamy spinach puree, seasoned with aromatic spices. Perfect with roti or paratha for a wholesome meal.
procedure: Blanch spinach leaves in hot water, then blend to a smooth puree.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, and sauté onions until translucent.
Add ginger-garlic paste and chopped tomatoes. Cook until soft.
Mix in turmeric, red chili powder, and garam masala. Stir well.
Add spinach puree to the mixture and simmer for 5 minutes.
Gently fold in paneer cubes and cook for another 3-4 minutes.
Garnish with cream or butter and serve hot with roti or paratha.

name: Chole Masala
description: A hearty and tangy curry made with tender chickpeas simmered in a rich, spiced onion-tomato gravy. Served with bhature or rice for a classic North Indian meal.
procedure: Soak chickpeas overnight and boil until tender.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, and sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and chopped tomatoes. Cook until soft.
Stir in turmeric, red chili powder, garam masala, and chole masala. Mix well.
Add boiled chickpeas to the gravy and simmer for 10-15 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander, julienned ginger, and a squeeze of lemon.
Serve hot with bhature, puri, or steamed rice.

name: Aloo Gobi
description: A classic Indian vegetarian dish made with potatoes and cauliflower cooked with earthy spices and a touch of turmeric. Pairs well with chapati or paratha for a comforting meal.
procedure: Cut potatoes and cauliflower into bite-sized pieces.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, and sauté onions until soft.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
Stir in turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Mix well.
Add potatoes and cauliflower. Toss to coat with spices.
Cover and cook on low heat until vegetables are tender. Stir occasionally.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with roti or paratha.

name: Dal Tadka
description: A comforting lentil dish made with yellow lentils cooked to perfection and tempered with garlic, cumin, and red chilies. Perfect with steamed rice or jeera rice for a soulful meal.
procedure: Wash and boil yellow lentils (toor dal) with turmeric until soft. Mash slightly.
Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds, and let them splutter.
Add chopped garlic, dry red chilies, and asafoetida (hing). Sauté until aromatic.
Stir in chopped tomatoes, green chilies, and garam masala. Cook until soft.
Pour the tempering over the cooked dal and mix well. Simmer for 2-3 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander and a dollop of ghee.
Serve hot with steamed rice or naan.

name: Gajar Ka Halwa
description: A classic Indian dessert made with grated carrots, milk, sugar, and ghee, topped with nuts for a rich and indulgent treat.
procedure: Wash, peel, and grate fresh carrots.
Heat ghee in a heavy-bottomed pan and add the grated carrots. Sauté for 5-7 minutes.
Add full-fat milk and cook the carrots on medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the milk reduces.
Stir in sugar and cook until it dissolves, and the mixture thickens.
Add cardamom powder and mix well.
Garnish with chopped nuts like almonds and cashews.
Serve warm or chilled for a delightful dessert.

name: Moong Dal Halwa
description: A rich and aromatic dessert made from yellow lentils, ghee, sugar, and milk, flavored with cardamom and garnished with nuts.
procedure: Wash and soak yellow moong dal for 3-4 hours. Grind to a coarse paste.
Heat ghee in a heavy-bottomed pan and add the moong dal paste.
Cook on low heat, stirring continuously, until the dal turns golden and releases a nutty aroma.
Gradually add warm milk while stirring to avoid lumps. Cook until the mixture thickens.
Add sugar and stir until it dissolves, and the halwa reaches a soft, glossy consistency.
Mix in cardamom powder and garnish with chopped nuts like pistachios and almonds.
Serve warm as a rich, festive dessert.

name: Pasta
description: A comforting and flavorful dish with boiled pasta tossed in a rich tomato-based sauce, herbs, and cheese, perfect for any occasion.
procedure: Boil pasta in salted water until al dente. Drain and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a pan and sauté minced garlic until aromatic.
Add chopped onions and cook until translucent.
Stir in tomato puree, salt, mixed herbs, and chili flakes. Simmer for 5-7 minutes.
Add boiled pasta to the sauce and mix well to coat.
Sprinkle grated cheese and toss gently. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
Garnish with fresh parsley and serve hot with garlic bread.

name: Noodles
description: A quick and savory dish with stir-fried noodles, colorful vegetables, and bold Asian sauces for a delightful flavor burst.
procedure: Boil noodles in salted water until cooked. Drain, rinse with cold water, and set aside.
Heat oil in a wok and sauté minced garlic and ginger until fragrant.
Add sliced carrots, capsicum, cabbage, and spring onions. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes.
Add soy sauce, chili sauce, vinegar, salt, and black pepper. Mix well.
Toss the boiled noodles into the wok and stir-fry until evenly coated.
Optional: Scramble eggs separately and mix into the noodles.
Garnish with sesame seeds or spring onion greens and serve hot.
